author: Special Correspondent
text:
At the event, CM will hear grievances from public pertaining to various depts.

Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar will resume his weekly janata durbar (people’s court) from Monday to directly hear the grievances of common people. The popular practice was discontinued after the model code of conduct was imposed on the State for the Assembly elections in October-November last year.

Mr. Kumar had started holding janata ke durbar mein Mukhyamantri (Chief Minister in people’s court) from April 2006, five months after he came to power in Bihar. The durbar dealing with grievances relating to specific government departments was held every Monday. A large number of people turn up to directly apprise the Chief Minister of their complaints.

“The CM will hold the first janata durbar of his third term as Chief Minister on February 1,” said an official.
title: Nitish to resume ‘janata durbar’ from February 1
